sentences.en: After his death, the soldier was cited for spunk.
sentences.cn: 那位士兵死后因作战勇敢而受到表彰.

sentences.en: Grandpa told a story with rare spunk last night.
sentences.cn: 昨天晚上祖父极其生动地讲了个故事.

sentences.en: He got his spunk up and told the truth.
sentences.cn: 他鼓起勇气,说出了真相.

sentences.en: He kept fighting on pure spunk.
sentences.cn: 他一直靠纯粹的勇气在打拼.

sentences.en: I admired her independ-ence and her spunk.
sentences.cn: 我敬佩她的独立精神和勇气。

sentences.en: I admired her independence and her spunk.
sentences.cn: 我敬佩她的独立精神和勇气。

sentences.en: I wouldn't give a dern for spunk - water. "
No need to spunk up, it's ok to speak your ideas to her.
sentences.cn: 没必要发火, 只要把你的意思告诉她就行了.

sentences.en: She had a lot of spunk.
Show some spunk . Quit pretending you're being abused.
sentences.cn: 慷慷慨慨! 甭装可怜虫!

sentences.en: Spunk - water! I wouldn't give a dern for spunk - water.
sentences.cn: “仙水! 我看仙水一文钱不值? ”

sentences.en: Spunk up before the public at least.
sentences.cn: 至少你要在公众面前打起精神来.

sentences.en: Spunk up, everything will be all right.
sentences.cn: 别恢心, 一切都会好起来的.

sentences.en: Talk about trying to cure warts with spunk - water such a blame fool way as that!
sentences.cn: 用那样糊涂蛋的方法还谈什么仙水治疣子!

sentences.en: Those kids had spunk who hiked through the forest in the dark.
sentences.cn: 那些黑夜里走过森林的孩子胆子真大.

sentences.en: You should spunk up and face the facts.
sentences.cn: 你应该振奋精神,勇敢地面对事实.

words.tran_cn: 有精神的；容易发怒的；充满勇气的；生气蓬勃的
